definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: There is no denying that our living qualities have gone from bad to worse.
sentences.chinese: 无可否认，我们的生活品质已经每况愈下。

sentences.english: Many regular customers have noticed that the service in this restaurant is in decline.
sentences.chinese: 许多老主顾都感觉到了这家饭店的服务质量每况愈下。

sentences.english: Their family financial circumstances are from bad to worse.
But Sandra’s health began to decline.
sentences.chinese: 但是萨德拉的健康却每况愈下。

sentences.english: He gets worse and worse and eventually it kills him.
There is no denying that the qualities of food in our refectory have gone from bad to worse .
sentences.chinese: 不可否认的，我们学校食堂食物的质量已经每况愈下。

sentences.english: "Behcet's disease" repeated attacks, deteriorating eyesight severe recession.
sentences.chinese: “贝西氏病”则反复发作，每况愈下，视力严重衰退。

sentences.english: You have sacrificed everything to economic growth, but that has weakened the worse-off.
sentences.chinese: 你们为了经济增长牺牲了一切，但那使经济每况愈下。

sentences.english: Graduating from the Imperial Academy, Daala's career was foundering.
sentences.chinese: 从帝国军校毕业后，达拉的事业每况愈下。

sentences.english: His health was getting steadily worse.; His health went steadily downhill.
First of all, urban traffic is getting from bad to worse.
sentences.chinese: 首先，城市交通每况愈下。

sentences.english: Life went downhill for poor Philo after that.
sentences.chinese: 自那以后可怜的菲洛的生活每况愈下。

sentences.english: During, economic situation worsens ceaselessly, superintendency environment also go from bad to worse.
sentences.chinese: 期间，经济形势不断恶化，监管环境也每况愈下。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, as Fuchai’s kingdom declined, Yue grew rich and raised a new army.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，当夫差的王国每况愈下，越国则富国强兵。

sentences.english: Left to themselves, things tend to go from bad to worse.
sentences.chinese: 大凡事物，听其自然就会每况愈下。

sentences.english: Occupied with club affairs, I neglected my studies, and my grades went from bad to worse.
sentences.chinese: 由于忙于社务，我忽略了课业，因此成绩每况愈下。

definition: rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
to develop rapidly after abrupt turn (idiom); dramatic change
to make progress only with great difficulty (idiom)
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
to decline/to fall/to drop/to falter/a decline/recession (in economics)
to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation

pinyin: wu1 lou4 pian1 feng2 lian2 ye4 yu3
